test_case_name: Pattern-based Structure Copy - JavaScript Files Backup
feature_description: Copy files by pattern while maintaining directory structure
env_setup:
# Clean the test directory
rm -rf ~/Desktop/oi/*

# Create directory structure
mkdir -p ~/Desktop/oi/Website/images/icons
mkdir -p ~/Desktop/oi/Website/styles
mkdir -p ~/Desktop/oi/Website/scripts/plugins

# Create image files
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/images/banner.jpg
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/images/logo.png
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/images/icons/home.svg
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/images/icons/search.svg

# Create CSS files
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/styles/main.css
touch ~/Desktop/oi/Website/styles/responsive.css

# Create JS files with some content
echo "// Main JavaScript functionality" > ~/Desktop/oi/Website/scripts/main.js
echo "// Form validation functions" > ~/Desktop/oi/Website/scripts/validation.js
echo "// Image slider implementation" > ~/Desktop/oi/Website/scripts/plugins/slider.js
echo "// Modal dialog functions" > ~/Desktop/oi/Website/scripts/plugins/modal.js
prompt: I need to create a backup of all my JavaScript files for the website project. Can you copy all .js files from the Website folder to a new folder called JS_Backup, but keep the same directory structure as the original?
expected_behaviour: The agent should create a new directory ~/Desktop/oi/JS_Backup/, use 'find' or similar commands to locate all JavaScript files (.js) in the Website directory, and copy them to the JS_Backup directory while preserving the original folder structure. The resulting structure should contain all four JavaScript files in their respective original paths. The agent should also report successful completion with a list of copied files.
